He begot one son and one daughter here, Shri Bhirachandraprabhu and Srimati Ganga Devi.
Shri Gaurav Ganesha Deepika reveals that Srimati Vasudha and Janava were actually the incarnations of the eternal concerts of Lord Balaram,
namely Srimati Varuni and Revati Devi respectively.
Shri Bhirachandraprabhu was none other than Shirodakshayi Vishnu, who manifests as the super soul in all of our hearts,
while Mother Ganges descended as Ganga Devi, the daughter of Lord Nithyananda.
So we saw the house where they were all staying after the lunch today afternoon.

Ganges. He sarcastically replied to Nithyananda that if he really needed a piece of land to stay
then he would have to create it out of water. Saying this, the zamindar threw a piece of
burning straw into the Ganges in order to mark the place on water where the zamindar
decided lord Nithyananda to set up his residence, making fun of lord Nithyananda Prabhu in front of
his friends. Nithyananda Prabhu who always remained very humble and without any anger
did not mind the zamindar's harsh words and assured the zamindar that whatever he had wished
though sarcastically would surely come to pass. What happened next stunned all present.
A huge mass of land suddenly appeared from the water.
A huge mass of land suddenly appeared from the water exactly at the place
where the burning piece of straw had hit it. Then this newly created island then got connected
with the mainland. This place subsequently came to be known as Kardaha. Kar means straw in Bengali.
Lord Nithai set up his residence on this piece of land and began residing with his family.
His transcendental house is presently renovated all over the three worlds
as Kunjavatika. There is a very sweet pastime that has been narrated in Abhirama Leelamrita
which talks of Shri Abhirama Gopala Thakura's arrival in Kardaha. Shri Abhirama Gopal Thakur,
one of the most prominent of the twelve cowherd boys, Dwaadasha Gopala, had a very powerful
personality. He was a great friend of an intimate associate of Shri Nithyananda Prabhu.
Shri Nithyananda Prabhu had a very powerful personality. He was a great friend of an intimate associate of Shri Nithyananda Prabhu.
Shri Nithyananda Prabhu had a very powerful personality. He was a great friend of an intimate associate of Shri Nithyananda Prabhu.
If Abhirama Thakur bowed down to any person who was not the lord
or empowered by the lord then that person would die immediately.
Similarly if he bowed down before any stone that was not a Saligramshila then that stone
would immediately crack. Several deities in Bengal had cracked just because Shri Abhirama had paid
them his obeisances. All the previous seven sons of Nithyananda Prabhu had died because
Sri Abhirama Thakur had paid them his dhandavats. However, when Sri Bhirachand Prabhu appeared
in this world, Lord Nithya was very careful not to invite Sri Abhirama Gopal Thakur to
attend his childbirth ceremony. He feared that Abhirama would again bow down and cause
harm to the child. Though Lord Nithya was an expansion of the Supreme Lord, yet he played
his part like a normal father and therefore expressed his concern and anguish. Nithyananda
Prabhu did not want to take any risk. He feared that Abhirama would still arrive uninvited.
Hence, he instructed all the boatsmen of Kardaha not to transport Abhirama Thakur to the other
side of Ganges in case he was seen that day. Sri Abhirama Gopal was a covert boy of Vrindavan
and he neither had any ego.
Nor did he care for any false prestige. In a very innocent mood, living behind all inhibitions,
he set out for Kardaha without any invitation to meet his dear friend and bless his newborn.
When Abhirama Thakur arrived on the bank of Ganges and asked the boatmen to carry him
to Kardaha, the boatmen panicked. Running out of options, they drowned their boats in
the water.
But Abhirama then simply spread his grace and said,
And then, sitting on that floating cloth, peacefully crossed over the river. Seeing
his prowess, all the onlookers were amazed. When Abhirama finally arrived at Kunjavatika,
Nithyananda Prabhu courteously embraced him and fed him sumptuously. Thereafter, in spite
of Srimati Janava and Vasudha Devi's place, Abhirama bowed down again and paid his obeisances
to little Birchandra.
When he saw that no harm was caused to the little child, he was overjoyed and composed
verses glorifying him, understanding that he was the expansion of the Supreme Lord.
In an innocent mood, he sang and danced in ecstasy. Thus, Sri Birchandra Prabhu had displayed
the exalted symptoms of divinity since his very birth. Sri Nithyananda Prabhu had performed
the most amazing pastimes here in Kardaha.
Which cannot be completely described even with a thousand mouths. Such was his magnanimity,
such was his mood, that he freely distributed the treasure of Lord's love. His uncommon,
unique pastime moved even the atheist to cry tears of love. Lord Nithya was almost completely
devoid of any external consciousness and remained intoxicated in an ecstatic love of God.
In such a state of utter ecstasy, he would sometimes jump high up in the air or at other
times roll over the ground while continuously glorifying the Supreme Lord. Sometimes he
would laugh and at other times streams of tears would roll down his beautiful eyes.
Srimati Janava Devi, Vasudha Devi and Birchandra Prabhu have all manifested their sweet pastimes
here and sanctified the holy track of land.
